results.title: La Substitution
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Le Tresor des Hollandais”.
A famous collection of jewels dubbed ‘Le Tresor des Hollandais’ is stolen between Asterdam and London. The jewels are now in possession of Morales, a night club owner in Paris. He employs Stephane, a young ballet dancer whose career has been shattered by injury. Stephane still has his entries at the Paris Opera House and Ballet School where his younger brother Bicou is also studying to be a dancer. Morales is using Stephane to subtitute the real jewels to the fake one worn by a mannequin used in the performances of the ballet ‘Coppelia’. The company is on the eve of a tour of Canada and Coppelia is to be used to smuggle the precious stones into the country. But on the night of the substitution nothing goes according to plan.

Credits: Director, Philippe Agostini; writer, Odette Joyeux; photography, Christian Petard; music, Georges Auric; choreography, Michel Descombey; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Claude Bessy, Claude Ariel, Catherine Bouchy, Pierre Didier, Felix marten, Jacques Fabbri, Robert Manuel.

results.title: La Stupenda: a portrait of Dame Joan Sutherland
results.creator_credit: Landseer Film and Television Productions, Brian Adams and Derek Bailey
results.brief_description: A celebration of the life and career of Australia’s most famous opera star, Dame Joan Sutherland, culminating in her farewell performances in Sydney and London in 1990. Sutherland’s career spanned more than forty years. “La Stupenda” provides an overview of the highlights of her career.
results.title_for_label: La Stupenda: a portrait of Dame Joan Sutherland

results.title: La Strada
results.creator_credit: Ponti-De Laurentis, Dino De Laurentiis, Carlo Ponti and Federico Fellini
results.brief_description: In this film Fellini uses the metaphor of a journey to explore what was to become one of his favourite themes - the search for meaning and purpose in life. Gelsomina (Giuletta Masina), a simple-minded peasant girl is sold to the circus strongman, Zampano (Anthony Quinn). As she accompanies him on tour through the countryside, she bercomes the victim of his constant abuse until their meeting with a circus performer (Richard Baseheart) dramatically changes their lives. This was the film that established Fellini as one of the leading lights of European Cinema.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ponti-De Laurentis, Dino De Laurentiis, Carlo Ponti and Federico Fellini

results.title: La Spagnola
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission, SBS Independent, Wild Strawberries, Anna-Maria Monticelli and Steve Jacobs
results.brief_description: Directed by Steve Jacobs and set in 1960, “La Spagnola” is one family’s story of the migrant experience in Australia. Lola (Lola Marceli) is a beautiful, tempestuous Spanish woman living in a remote industrial town with her boorish husband, Ricardo (Simon Palomares), and their teenage daughter, Lucia (Alice Ansara). When Ricardo decides to leave her for his Australian mistress, Lola is left destitute and pregnant turns violent and vengeful. Her daughter, sensitive, lonely, mocked at school, and confused by her mother’s anger toward her, seeks refuge in an aunt and tries to reconcile with her absent father. Lola is driven by a quest for revenge against the two who have robbed her of her only security in a strange land. Lola and Lucia, each striking out hatefully at the other, are on a collision course, plotting their separate plans for vengeance. Also starring Alex Dimitriades as a local playboy, romantically interested in both mother and daughter. Mostly in Spanish, with Italian and English, and with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Film Commission, SBS Independent, Wild Strawberries, Anna-Maria Monticelli and Steve Jacobs

results.title: La solitude du chanteur de fond = The Loneliness of the Long Distance Singer
results.brief_description:
In 1974, Chirs Marker followed singer Yves Montand as he was preparing a benefit concert for the Chilean refugees. Without any commentary, but with virtuoso editing and many insightful close-ups, Chris Marker sketches a warm portrait of the singer. He analyses Montand’s political engagement, his tension before the show and his relationship with his pianist, Bob Castella.

Credits: Director, Chris Marker ; photography, Pierre Lhomme, Yann Le Masson.
Cast: Yves Montand.

results.title: La Sentence = the Sentence
results.brief_description:
In September 1944, four resistance fighters and a fisherman are captured by German soldiers after a failed grenade attack. They are taken to the basement of a deserted house while awaiting their fate. They are to be executed in the morning.

Credits: Producer, Christine Gouze-Renal ; director, Jean Valere ; writers, Georges-Jan Arnaud, Marcel Moussy, Jean Valere ; photography, Henri Decae ; music, Daniel Lesur ; art direction, Bernard Evein, Jacques Saulnier.
Cast: Robert Hossein, Marina Vlady, Roger Hanin, Beatrice Bretty, Lucien Raimbourg.

results.title: La Sel de la terre
results.creator_credit: Intermondia Films, V. Blavier and Georges Rouquier
results.brief_description: Lyrical impression of the Camargue county at the mouth of the Rhone - long, flat reaches of salt impregnated land, rich in bird and animal life. The latter sequences deal with the draining of the land its fertilization and bringing it into production. Sparse commentary in French.

results.title: La scalo lo scalone
results.brief_description: A child born to Italian parents in country Victoria learns about his growing sexuality. In innocence he and his friends play the usual child games of Doctors and Nurses as a natural means of learning. His play is fettered by religious guilt (that he’s yet to understand) and further complicated my his mother’s sudden death. A story about the loss of innocence - both as a state of mind and a time in one’s life that will never be the same again.

results.title: La Rupture = The Breakup
results.creator_credit: Euro International, Les Films de la Boetie, Cinevog Films and Claude Chabrol
results.brief_description:
A wife and mother, Helene, battles to defend herself and her child against an attack by her husband Charles while he is under the influence of LSD. With his son in hospital her father-in-law moves to gain custody of the child by employing the needy Paul to spy on Helene in order to find cause. This is the fourth of Chabrol’s series of thrillers set in bourgeois households, usually involving a triangle, that began with ‘Les Biches’ (1968). It also involves a further variant on the redemption-through-the-assumption-of-guilt theme recurring in Chabrol’s films, which he found, as a critic, recurring in Hitchcock’s work. Also available on VHS.

Credits: Director, [script], Claude Chabrol ; photography, Jean Rabier ; music, Pierre Jansen ; editor, Jacques Gaillard ; sound, Guy Chichignoud.
Cast: Stephane Audran, Jean-Pierre Cassel, Michel Bouquet, Annie Cordy, Jean-Claude Drouot, Michel Duchaussoy.

Note: Based on the novel by Charlotte Armstrong “Le jour des parques”.
